clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Ocular Lens Proteins in Cataract From Individuals With Down Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Ocular Lens Proteins in Cataract From Individuals With Down Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: This study involves the collection ocular lens tissue from individuals with Down syndrome and age-matched controls at the time of cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Individuals with Down syndrome have an increased rate of cataract. The reason for this increase is unclear. Normally, once cataracts become a significant impairment, an ophthalmologist will determine when cataract surgery should be performed. When this surgery is performed, cataractous tissues are cut out and discarded with medical waste. In this study, these tissue will be collected and protein analysis performed to determine what changes in different proteins are found in Down syndrome lenses as compared to normal cataractous lenses.

clinical_study.why_stopped: researcher left the institution study will not continue

primary_outcome.time_frame: one week after collection of tissue
primary_outcome.description: western blot analysis of proteins from cataractous tissue

arm_group.description: Individuals with Down syndrome undergoing cataract surgery.

biospec_descr.textblock: cataractous tissue removed at time of cataract surgery

study_pop.textblock: Individuals with Down syndrome having cataract surgery or age-matched control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing cataract surgery for lens extraction.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known genetic cause other than Down syndrome causing cataract.
